meanings.definition: To extend out, project, or stick out
meanings.sent1: The tree branches jutty from the trunk.
meanings.sent2: His pencil juttyed out of the pencil holder.
meanings.sent3: The curious squirrel's tail juttyed out as it peeked around the corner.
meanings.sent4: Her determination juttyed through her actions, showing her resolve.
meanings.sent5: The mountain peak juttyed into the sky, reaching for the clouds.

meanings.definition: A projecting part or point, especially of a building
meanings.sent1: The castle's jutty overlooked the valley below.
meanings.sent2: The balcony's jutty provided a perfect view of the sunset.
meanings.sent3: The bird built its nest on the building's jutty, enjoying the high vantage point.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse's jutty guided ships safely to shore in the storm.
meanings.sent5: The old church's jutty added character to its architecture, drawing in visitors.
